A NOTE ON THE BONUS CHARTER
While I was working with the producers for the film version of The Host, I started to think about some of the other perspectives that might make their way onto the screen when the story can no longer be perfectly first person. There was one moment in particular that had always existed in my head, though it couldn't appear in the novel because my narrator was unconscious at the time. I decided to write it down, just in case the director was interested in showing that scene. Chronology-wise, this scene falls in between chapters 58 and 59 of The Host. STEPHENIE MEYER'S ANNOTATED PLAYLIST FOR THE HOST

I end up using the phrase "this song fits into the moment when... " over and over again. It's dead boring. So instead of explaining each song's place, I've listed the character from whose perspective I hear the lyrics (most of them are Wanderer, naturally) and added a quote that gives an example of a moment when that song fits the action/emotion in my head.
Some of the songs are very specific to the scene ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½ like #15, "Don't Stay" by Linkin Park. Others are more widely applicable, corresponding to big themes throughout the story ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½ like #3, "Futurism" by Muse, and #22, "Original of the Species" by U2. In those cases, I still pulled just one quote, but one that I think hints at the whole theme. Also, a few of the songs are out of order on my website.
